title: Schwarz–Christoffel mapping
summary: In complex analysis,  a Schwarz–Christoffel mapping is a conformal map of the  upper half-plane or the complex unit disk onto the interior of a simple polygon. Such a map is guaranteed to exist by the Riemann mapping theorem (stated by Bernhard Riemann in 1851); the Schwarz–Christoffel formula provides an explicit construction. They were introduced independently by Elwin Christoffel in 1867 and  Hermann Schwarz in 1869.
